greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of A048673 and its Dirichlet inverse, A323893.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16383
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
program: DirInverse(v) = { my(u=vector(#v)); u[1] = (1/v[1]); for(n=2, #v, u[n] = -sumdiv(n, d, if(d<n, v[n/d]*u[d], 0))); (u) }; \\ Compute the Dirichlet inverse of the sequence given in input vector v.
A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ From A003961
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 08 2019
